result.execSummary:
The defendant John Charles Stenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on February 1, 2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment. Bond to be applied.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 to the Clerk of Court Office by payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on February 1, 2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be civil judgment. Bond to be applied.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. No voting until civil rights are restored. No holding of elective office.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
